results.title: Australian Landscape Painters (Italian Version)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Art”.
The Australian artist has no greater challenge than his own landscape, but few have been completely successful in depicting it. Using both the artists’ words and their work, this film studies such men as Russell Drysdale, Tom Roberts and Sir Heysen, and shows why and how they have transmuted landscape into art
results.description:

results.title: Farm Newsreel No. 1
results.brief_description: This newsreel film features agricultural activities throughout Victoria, Australia. Activities featured include hop harvesting in Myrtleford, tobacco harvesting in Ovens Valley, onion harvesting in Colac, and silage distibution in Upper Pakenham.

results.title: Farm Machinery Maintenance
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson, Solarchrome and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: ‘Farm Machinery Maintenance’ is an instructional film made for the Commonwealth Department of Primary Industry, designed for an audience of farmers and agricultural workers. The film’s narrator outlines the importance of maintaining farm machinery and equipment to ensure their function and longevity. The film offers an interesting insight into farming methods of the 1950s, with footage of rural farms, machines and tools. As with many educational films of the era, the film displays a (now outdated) gender division of stereotypical roles for men and for women, with men operating the heavy machinery while women serve tea and pick fruit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Thompson, Solarchrome and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: A Crop of records
results.brief_description: In 1960, Victoria’s wheat growing record was smashed by a bumper harvest. 95% of the wheat was from varieties bred by the Victorian Department of Agriculture including Pinnacle; Insignia; Beacon; and Olympic. Don Rooney, an agronomist in the Wimmera region talks to Victorian farmer Harry Bouchier about his record harvest. We follow the wheat’s journey from the farm, to the silos and finally being loaded onto cargo ships at the Port of Geelong headed for international destinations.
results.description: In 1960, Victoria’s wheat growing record was smashed by a bumper harvest. 95% of the wheat was from varieties bred by the Victorian Department of Agriculture including Pinnacle; Insignia; Beacon; and Olympic. We follow the wheat’s journey from the farm, to the silos and finally being loaded onto cargo ships at the Port of Geelong headed for international destinations.

results.title: Athol Adams Collection
results.brief_description:
Athol Adams was a well known portrait photographer who documented his life in Dandenong in the 1950s. Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

Athol was born 30/05/1916. He grew up in Box Hill, Victoria. Served in the RAAF in World War II in the area of reconnaissance where he commenced an interest in photography. Settled in Dandenong in the late 1940’s where he became a well known portrait photographer through until 1960, when he closed the business. He continued his profession as a photographer working for such companies as Volkswagen and Foodland. He was married to Carmen for 52 years, had four children, and was a loving husband and father.

results.title: Centenary of Bright
results.brief_description:
Begins with landscape shots outside of Bright, before focusing on the centenary celebrations, including crowds and reinactments of life in Bright 100 years ago. Film then follows a parade, highlighting the numerous floats involved.

Good footage of 20m high tress being cut down as part of a carnival.

Deputy Premier A.G Rylah unviels the Bright centenary Cairn, gives speech about the importnace of young people in a community.

Film nicely shot, with vibrant colours.

results.title: Henry Bolte speech at opening of relocated Dandenong Stock Market (1958)
results.brief_description:
Silent film footage of the then Premier of Victoria, Henry Bolte, presenting his speech at the opening of the Dandenong Stock Market at its new location in Cheltenham Road (1958). Includes scenes of dignitaries and spectators, and a tour of the stockyards.
Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.
THIS FILM IS SILENT
